result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Plea/sentencing hearing on November 21, 2022 at 09:00 am.

2:00 PM Defendant Adam J Fudge appeared by video, in custody. Attorney Brandon K. Carlson in court for Adam J Fudge.  Prosecuting attorney Lindsey Hirt in court for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Carlson requests a plea and sentencing hearing in about 30-45 days.  No objection by the State. Court will adjourn for plea and sentencing.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 21, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Filed by Atty Carlson requesting the defendant appear by zoom from MSDF for the next court date.
Hearing on October 31, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Adam J Fudge
Current: c/o Milwaukee Secure Detention Facility, P.O. Box 05740, Milwaukee, WI 53233 United States  (Effective: 10-19-2022)
Prior: 515 W Moreland Blvd, c/o Waukesha County Jail, Waukesha, WI 53188 United States

9:31 AM; Case called for Hearing.  Attorney Brandon K. Carlson in court for Adam J Fudge.  Prosecuting attorney Jack A. Pitzo in court for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney appears by authorization. Atty. Carlson provides an update; he just received an email from a social worker at MSDF advising his client is currently in custody there and is not sure why.  Atty. Carlson confirms he has an offer but has not been able to get in touch with his client to review the offer.  Atty. Carlson requests another further proceeding date in about 30-45 days.  No objection by the State.  Court adjourns for further proceedings but will set for a sooner date.
Hearing scheduled for October 31, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Authorization to appear received and filed.
Hearing on October 19, 2022 at 09:30 am.

2:34 PM; Case called for Bail/bond hearing.  Prosecuting attorney Andrea M Will in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Adam J Fudge in court.  Attorney Brandon K. Carlson in court for Adam J Fudge. Court notes the matter was on the calendar for this morning at 10:30 and as the defendant failed to appear the court issued a capias and ordered bail be forfeited.  Atty. Carlson presents statements; he notes the defendant advised him he did email the signed authorization which is why the defendant did not appear for court this morning.  Atty. Carlson also notes the defendant is no present in court, so he is asking the court not issue the capias and reinstate bail.  No objection by the State.  Court will quash the capias and reinstate the previously posted cash bail.  Court inquires as to the status of the case.  Atty. Carlson provides an update; he is requesting a further proceedings date in about 30-45 days.  No objection by the State. Court adjourns for further proceedings.
Hearing scheduled for October 19, 2022 at 09:30 am.

10:35 AM; Case called for Hearing. Prosecuting attorney Patrick Ryan Campbell in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Adam J Fudge not in court.  Attorney Brandon K. Carlson in court for Adam J Fudge.  Atty. Carlson advises he attempted to get his client to complete an authorization but it was not completed; he also notes he informed his client if he does not returned the completed authorization his client would need to appear in person today.  Atty. Carlson has no explanation for his client's non-appearance.  State requests a capias be issued.  Court will issue a capias and orders bail  be forfeited.
Bench Warrant not issued as defendant appeared for another hearing later in the afternoon.  (am)
Court's response to defendant's letter filed on 08/26/2022.
to the Court filed by defendant requesting a change of court date.  **Reviewed by Judge Reilly, for Branch 7, 9/1/22 - Request denied as defendant has counsel.**
Hearing on September 12, 2022 at 10:30 am.

Waukesha County Jail Inmate Communication Form dated 8/22/22 from the defendant re: asking for a copy of any future court dates.

**Notice of hearing for the next court date sent to the defendant at the jail**

9:05 AM; Case called for Bail/bond hearing.  Prosecuting attorney Christian Farina in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Adam J Fudge in court, in custody at WCJ.  Attorney Brandon K. Carlson in court for Adam J Fudge. Court notes the matter is before the Court on Defendant's Motion to Modify Bail.  Atty. Carlson presents arguments; he is asking the bond be amended to a signature bond.  State objects and presents statements.  Court inquires if there is any information about the defendant's employment.  Atty. Carlson advises it would be a Speedway and the job is open and waiting for his client.  For reasons placed on the record the Court will deny Defense's Motion to Modify Bail; bail to remain as previously set.  Court advises Atty. Carlson that if he is able to receive written verification of the defendant's employment it will entertain another bail motion.  Court will maintain the previously scheduled hearing set for 09/12/2022 at 10:30 a.m.
Bail/bond hearing on August 18, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Filed by Atty Carlson
Effective August 1, 2022, this case is assigned to Branch 7 Judicial Vacancy, pursuant to 22-SO-04(67).
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection.
